datastructures

Interface Graph.Edge<O>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - The type stored in the Edge.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing interface:
    Graph<E,O>

    public static interface Graph.Edge<O>
extends java.io.Serializable
    The edge interface represents the connection in a Graph. An edge is also called arcs by some documents. Implementing classes could customize some behavior but the core methods should be the same or at least behave similarly, so the Graph classes can use them.
    Since:
    25-8-2014
    Version:
    25-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    Graph, Graph.edges()

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        <E> Graph.Vertex<E> getSource()
        Returns the starting point of the edge.
        Returns:
        The source of the edge.

      • getDestination

        <E> Graph.Vertex<E> getDestination()
        Gets the destination of this vertex.
        Returns:
        The end point of this edge.

      • getEndPoints

        default <E> Graph.Vertex<E>[] getEndPoints()
        Returns the endpoints of this edge in an array. The first index is equal to getSource() and the second index is equal to getDestination().
        Returns:
        An array of the endpoints in an array.

      • hashCode

        static <O> int hashCode(Graph.Edge<O> edge)
        Calculates the hashCode by the way proposed by hashCode().
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to calculate the hash code of.
        Returns:
        The hash code.

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Calculates the hash code of the given edge. The hash code is calculated by

        if (edge.getElement() != null) {
        hash += 2 * edge.getElement().hashCode();
        divider = 4;
        }
        else {
        divider = 2;
        }
        hash += edge.getSource().hashCode();
        hash += edge.getDestination().hashCode();
        hash = hash / divider;

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The hash code.

        Returns:

      • getElement

        O getElement()
        Gets the element of this edge.
        Returns:
